intro: Phoradendron burkartii, commonly known as the Burkart's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on various host trees in the Americas. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its woody stems and evergreen leaves. The plant relies on its host for water and some nutrients, while producing its own carbohydrates through photosynthesis. It produces small, white or greenish flowers and red berries that are dispersed by birds. Due to its parasitic nature, it can have significant impacts on the health of its host trees.
